title: Mobile Assistive Learning Environment Design and Development for Totally Blind Students

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Special Education and Digital Assistive Technology Understanding
context.additional_context: Development of language education application cases for pre-service teachers, establishing a smartphone-based accessible learning environment

learning_goals: Learners can design three types of learning materials (text, image descriptions, quizzes) for blind students using mobile applications with text-to-speech (TTS) functionality (e.g., Voice Dream Reader, TalkBack) and produce resources meeting over 80% accessibility standards verified by tools like WAVE or Axe.

Learners can establish three or more blended teaching strategies (pre-video learning + real-time workshops) based on the flipped learning model, pilot them in two company departments, and submit a report achieving over 80% participant satisfaction.

Learners can collect and analyze over 20 user feedbacks within six months to design and prototype an accessibility-based mobile learning environment improvement process meeting over 80% of WCAG 2.1 AA criteria.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
